required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Clinical Trial of Occlusal Sealant
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of the Intermediary Layer on Sealant Retention: A Randomized 24-month Clinical Trial

collaborator.agency: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior.

brief_summary.textblock: This study assessed long-term impact of tooth Eruption Stages (ES) on sealant retention on occlusal surfaces previously coated with intermediary bonding layer and it determined caries incidence outcome evolved. The treatment were (sealant/technique): Fluroshield; Helioseal Clear Chroma; Single Bond and Fluroshield; Excite and Helioseal Clear Chroma.

detailed_description.textblock: The greatest risk of sealant failure occurs soon after tooth eruption, when contamination with saliva and gingival fluid is almost inevitable. The use of an intermediate bonding layer between humidity contaminated enamel and sealant can improve bond strength, reduces microleakage, and enhances resin flow into fissures. The benefit of primer and adhesive layer beneath the sealant seems to be based on a combination of moisture-chasing effects of the hydrophilic primer, increased flow dispersion imparted by the less viscous primer and adhesive and increased flexibility of the combined and polymerized primer/adhesive/resin complex once reaction is complete.

primary_outcome.measure: Sealant retention and prevention of dental caries assessed by defined clinical scoring system
primary_outcome.description: Clinical scoring system: adapted criteria proposed by Feigal et al. (2000)

arm_group.description: Pit and fissure sealing using only sealant

arm_group.arm_group_label: Single Bond and F (Adhesive and Sealant)
arm_group.description: Pit and fissure sealing using adhesive and sealant
Pit and fissure sealing using only sealant
Pit and fissure sealing using adhesive and sealant

intervention.description: Application of preventive agent and technique for control moisture
intervention.arm_group_label: Single Bond and F (Adhesive and Sealant)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Four caries-free erupted first molar permanent teeth; no systemic diseases and no dental material allergies.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Carious or absence first molar permanent teeth.

overall_official.affiliation: Piracicaba Dental Scholl - University of Campinas
Piracicaba Dental Scholl - University of Campinas

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Profa. Dra. Regina Maria Puppin Rontani
